title: Developer options
answer:
Touch Settings > About phone > Build number > Developer options. 

  USB debugging: You can run ADB commands to debug the phone. 

  Stay awake: The screen does not sleep when charging. 

  Allow mock locations: The mock location function is enabled. 

  Desktop backup password: You can set the backup password. 

  Pointer location: The current touch data is displayed when you touch the screen. 

  Show touches: Visual feedback is shown for touches. 

  Show CPU usage: The CPU usage is displayed. 

  Forced GPU rendering: 2D hardware acceleration is used in applications. 

  Windows animation scale: The scaling speed is under control. 

  Background process limit: The number of background processes is limited. 

  Show all ANRs: App Not Responding dialog boxes are displayed for background applications.
